description: Extended ICD-10-CM codes for chest CT radiology - Respiratory, Neoplasms, and Related

entries.title: A15.0 - Tuberculosis of Lung
entries.content: Tuberculosis of lung, confirmed by sputum microscopy with or without culture. Primary pulmonary TB. CT findings include upper lobe consolidation, tree-in-bud nodules, cavitation, and lymphadenopathy.

entries.title: A15.3 - Tuberculosis of Intrathoracic Lymph Nodes
entries.content: Tuberculosis of intrathoracic lymph nodes. Mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy due to TB. Nodes may show central low attenuation (necrosis) with peripheral rim enhancement.

entries.title: A16.2 - Tuberculosis of Lung, Without Mention of Bacteriological Confirmation
entries.content: Tuberculosis of lung without bacteriological or histological confirmation. Use when TB is diagnosed clinically or radiologically but culture/smear negative.

entries.title: B37.1 - Pulmonary Candidiasis
entries.content: Pulmonary candidiasis. Fungal lung infection, typically in immunocompromised patients. CT may show nodules, consolidation, or ground-glass opacities.

entries.title: B44.0 - Invasive Pulmonary Aspergillosis
entries.content: Invasive pulmonary aspergillosis. Severe fungal infection in immunocompromised hosts. Classic CT finding is halo sign (nodule with surrounding GGO) or air crescent sign.

entries.title: B44.1 - Other Pulmonary Aspergillosis
entries.content: Other pulmonary aspergillosis including chronic pulmonary aspergillosis and aspergilloma. Aspergilloma appears as mobile intracavitary mass with air crescent sign.

entries.title: B45.0 - Pulmonary Cryptococcosis
entries.content: Pulmonary cryptococcosis. Fungal infection that may present as nodules, masses, or consolidation. Can mimic lung cancer. More common in immunocompromised but can occur in immunocompetent.

entries.title: B59 - Pneumocystosis
entries.content: Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia (PJP/PCP). Opportunistic infection in AIDS and immunocompromised. CT shows bilateral perihilar ground-glass opacities with apical sparing. May have pneumatoceles.

entries.title: B90.9 - Sequelae of Respiratory Tuberculosis
entries.content: Sequelae of respiratory and unspecified tuberculosis. Chronic changes from prior TB including fibrosis, bronchiectasis, calcified granulomas, and volume loss.

entries.title: C33 - Malignant Neoplasm of Trachea
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of trachea. Primary tracheal carcinoma is rare. Types include squamous cell carcinoma and adenoid cystic carcinoma. CT shows intraluminal mass or wall thickening.

entries.title: C38.1 - Malignant Neoplasm of Anterior Mediastinum
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of anterior mediastinum. Includes thymoma, thymic carcinoma, germ cell tumors, and lymphoma. CT shows anterior mediastinal mass, may have calcification or cystic areas.

entries.title: C38.2 - Malignant Neoplasm of Posterior Mediastinum
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of posterior mediastinum. Includes neurogenic tumors, esophageal cancer extension, and metastatic disease. CT shows posterior mediastinal mass.

entries.title: C38.3 - Malignant Neoplasm of Mediastinum, Part Unspecified
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of mediastinum, part unspecified. Use when mediastinal malignancy location (anterior/middle/posterior) is not specified.

entries.title: C38.4 - Malignant Neoplasm of Pleura
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of pleura. Includes mesothelioma and primary pleural malignancies. CT shows pleural thickening, nodularity, and effusion. Circumferential thickening suggests mesothelioma.

entries.title: C45.0 - Mesothelioma of Pleura
entries.content: Mesothelioma of pleura. Malignant tumor arising from mesothelial cells, strongly associated with asbestos exposure. CT shows circumferential pleural thickening, nodularity, volume loss, and effusion.

entries.title: C77.1 - Secondary Malignant Neoplasm of Intrathoracic Lymph Nodes
entries.content: Secondary malignant neoplasm of intrathoracic lymph nodes. Metastatic cancer involving mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes. CT shows enlarged nodes (>10mm short axis).

entries.title: C78.2 - Secondary Malignant Neoplasm of Pleura
entries.content: Secondary malignant neoplasm of pleura. Metastatic disease to pleura. CT shows pleural effusion, nodular pleural thickening. Common primaries: lung, breast, ovarian.

entries.title: C79.51 - Secondary Malignant Neoplasm of Bone
entries.content: Secondary malignant neoplasm of bone. Bone metastases. On chest CT, look for lytic or blastic lesions in ribs, spine, sternum. Important incidental finding.

entries.title: D15.0 - Benign Neoplasm of Thymus
entries.content: Benign neoplasm of thymus. Thymoma without evidence of invasion. CT shows well-circumscribed anterior mediastinal mass. May have capsular calcification.

entries.title: D15.1 - Benign Neoplasm of Heart
entries.content: Benign neoplasm of heart. Includes cardiac myxoma, lipoma, fibroma. May be detected incidentally on chest CT as cardiac mass.

entries.title: D15.2 - Benign Neoplasm of Mediastinum
entries.content: Benign neoplasm of mediastinum. Includes benign neurogenic tumors, cysts, lipomas. CT appearance depends on specific tumor type.

entries.title: D86.0 - Sarcoidosis of Lung
entries.content: Sarcoidosis of lung. Granulomatous disease with pulmonary involvement. CT shows bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy, perilymphatic nodules, and upper lobe predominant fibrosis.

entries.title: D86.1 - Sarcoidosis of Lymph Nodes
entries.content: Sarcoidosis of lymph nodes. Lymph node involvement in sarcoidosis. Classic pattern is bilateral hilar and right paratracheal lymphadenopathy (1-2-3 sign).

entries.title: D86.2 - Sarcoidosis of Lung with Sarcoidosis of Lymph Nodes
entries.content: Sarcoidosis of lung with sarcoidosis of lymph nodes. Combined pulmonary and nodal sarcoidosis. Most common presentation with both parenchymal and nodal disease.

entries.title: I26.99 - Other Pulmonary Embolism Without Acute Cor Pulmonale
entries.content: Other pulmonary embolism without acute cor pulmonale. PE without right heart strain. CT shows filling defect in pulmonary arteries without RV dilation.

entries.title: I26.92 - Saddle Embolus of Pulmonary Artery Without Acute Cor Pulmonale
entries.content: Saddle embolus of pulmonary artery without acute cor pulmonale. Large PE straddling the main pulmonary artery bifurcation. High-risk finding requiring urgent treatment.

entries.title: I26.01 - Septic Pulmonary Embolism With Acute Cor Pulmonale
entries.content: Septic pulmonary embolism with acute cor pulmonale. Infected emboli, often from endocarditis or IV drug use. CT shows multiple peripheral nodules with feeding vessel sign, may cavitate.

entries.title: I27.0 - Primary Pulmonary Hypertension
entries.content: Primary pulmonary hypertension (idiopathic PAH). CT shows enlarged main pulmonary artery (>29mm), right heart enlargement, and mosaic attenuation pattern.

entries.title: I27.20 - Pulmonary Hypertension, Unspecified
entries.content: Pulmonary hypertension, unspecified. Elevated pulmonary artery pressure of unspecified cause. CT findings include dilated pulmonary arteries and right heart enlargement.

entries.title: I27.82 - Chronic Pulmonary Embolism
entries.content: Chronic pulmonary embolism. Chronic thromboembolic disease. CT shows eccentric wall-adherent thrombus, webs/bands, mosaic perfusion, and bronchial artery hypertrophy.

entries.title: I71.01 - Dissection of Thoracic Aorta
entries.content: Dissection of thoracic aorta. Life-threatening condition with intimal tear and false lumen creation. CT shows intimal flap, true and false lumens, and may show branch vessel involvement.

entries.title: I71.2 - Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm, Without Rupture
entries.content: Thoracic aortic aneurysm without rupture. Dilation of thoracic aorta. Ascending aorta >4.5cm or descending >4.0cm is aneurysmal. Monitor for growth.

entries.title: J09.X1 - Influenza Due to Identified Novel Influenza A Virus with Pneumonia
entries.content: Influenza due to identified novel influenza A virus with pneumonia. Viral pneumonia from novel influenza strains. CT shows bilateral GGO, consolidation, and may have crazy-paving pattern.

entries.title: J10.00 - Influenza Due to Other Identified Influenza Virus with Unspecified Type of Pneumonia
entries.content: Influenza with pneumonia, other identified influenza virus. Seasonal influenza pneumonia. CT may show bilateral patchy consolidation and ground-glass opacities.

entries.title: J12.89 - Other Viral Pneumonia
entries.content: Other viral pneumonia. Pneumonia caused by viruses not elsewhere classified. CT findings vary but often show bilateral GGO and consolidation.

entries.title: J12.82 - Pneumonia Due to Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
entries.content: Pneumonia due to COVID-19. SARS-CoV-2 pneumonia. Classic CT findings: bilateral peripheral GGO, crazy-paving pattern, consolidation with air bronchograms, organizing pneumonia pattern.

entries.title: J13 - Pneumonia Due to Streptococcus Pneumoniae
entries.content: Pneumococcal pneumonia. Most common bacterial pneumonia. CT typically shows lobar consolidation with air bronchograms. May have parapneumonic effusion.

entries.title: J14 - Pneumonia Due to Hemophilus Influenzae
entries.content: Haemophilus influenzae pneumonia. Bacterial pneumonia, more common in COPD patients. CT shows bronchopneumonia pattern or lobar consolidation.

entries.title: J15.0 - Pneumonia Due to Klebsiella Pneumoniae
entries.content: Klebsiella pneumonia. Gram-negative bacterial pneumonia, often in alcoholics or diabetics. CT may show bulging fissure sign and early cavitation, typically upper lobe.

entries.title: J15.1 - Pneumonia Due to Pseudomonas
entries.content: Pseudomonas pneumonia. Nosocomial or healthcare-associated pneumonia. CT shows bronchopneumonia pattern, may rapidly progress to necrosis and abscess formation.

entries.title: J15.20 - Pneumonia Due to Staphylococcus, Unspecified
entries.content: Staphylococcal pneumonia. May cause necrotizing pneumonia with abscess formation and pneumatoceles. Associated with influenza superinfection and IV drug use.

entries.title: J15.211 - Pneumonia Due to MRSA
entries.content: Pneumonia due to methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). Severe bacterial pneumonia with high morbidity. CT often shows necrotizing pneumonia with cavitation.

entries.title: J15.4 - Pneumonia Due to Other Streptococci
entries.content: Pneumonia due to other streptococci (non-pneumococcal). Includes Group A streptococcal pneumonia which may cause rapid progression and empyema.

entries.title: J15.6 - Pneumonia Due to Other Gram-Negative Bacteria
entries.content: Pneumonia due to other gram-negative bacteria. Includes E. coli, Enterobacter, Serratia pneumonias. Often healthcare-associated with bronchopneumonia pattern.

entries.title: J15.7 - Pneumonia Due to Mycoplasma Pneumoniae
entries.content: Mycoplasma pneumonia. Atypical pneumonia, common in young adults. CT shows patchy consolidation, GGO, centrilobular nodules, and bronchial wall thickening.

entries.title: J16.0 - Chlamydial Pneumonia
entries.content: Chlamydial pneumonia. Atypical pneumonia caused by Chlamydia pneumoniae. CT findings similar to mycoplasma with patchy consolidation and GGO.

entries.title: J17 - Pneumonia in Diseases Classified Elsewhere
entries.content: Pneumonia in diseases classified elsewhere. Code underlying disease first. Includes pneumonia in viral diseases, mycoses, and parasitic diseases.

entries.title: J18.0 - Bronchopneumonia, Unspecified Organism
entries.content: Bronchopneumonia, unspecified organism. Patchy airspace disease involving multiple lobules. CT shows multifocal patchy consolidation and tree-in-bud nodules.

entries.title: J21.9 - Acute Bronchiolitis, Unspecified
entries.content: Acute bronchiolitis, unspecified. Inflammation of bronchioles, common in infants. CT shows centrilobular nodules, tree-in-bud pattern, and air trapping.

entries.title: J40 - Bronchitis, Not Specified as Acute or Chronic
entries.content: Bronchitis, not specified as acute or chronic. Inflammation of bronchi. CT may show bronchial wall thickening. Often a clinical diagnosis.

entries.title: J42 - Unspecified Chronic Bronchitis
entries.content: Unspecified chronic bronchitis. Chronic productive cough. CT shows bronchial wall thickening. Part of COPD spectrum.

entries.title: J44.0 - COPD with Acute Lower Respiratory Infection
entries.content: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with acute lower respiratory infection. COPD exacerbation with superimposed infection. CT shows emphysema plus acute consolidation or GGO.

entries.title: J44.1 - COPD with (Acute) Exacerbation
entries.content: COPD with acute exacerbation. Worsening of COPD symptoms without documented infection. CT shows emphysema and may have increased bronchial wall thickening.

entries.title: J44.9 - Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, Unspecified
entries.content: COPD, unspecified. Chronic airflow limitation. CT shows emphysema (low attenuation areas), bronchial wall thickening, and air trapping on expiratory images.

entries.title: J60 - Coalworker's Pneumoconiosis
entries.content: Coalworker's pneumoconiosis (black lung disease). Occupational lung disease from coal dust. CT shows upper lobe predominant nodules, progressive massive fibrosis.

entries.title: J61 - Pneumoconiosis Due to Asbestos and Other Mineral Fibers
entries.content: Asbestosis and asbestos-related disease. CT shows lower lobe predominant fibrosis, pleural plaques (often calcified), rounded atelectasis, and increased mesothelioma risk.

entries.title: J62.8 - Pneumoconiosis Due to Other Dust Containing Silica
entries.content: Silicosis. Occupational lung disease from silica dust. CT shows upper lobe predominant nodules with eggshell calcification of hilar nodes. May progress to PMF.

entries.title: J67.9 - Hypersensitivity Pneumonitis Due to Unspecified Organic Dust
entries.content: Hypersensitivity pneumonitis (extrinsic allergic alveolitis). Immune reaction to inhaled antigens. CT shows centrilobular GGO nodules, mosaic attenuation, and air trapping.

entries.title: J69.0 - Pneumonitis Due to Inhalation of Food and Vomit
entries.content: Aspiration pneumonitis. Chemical pneumonitis from aspiration of gastric contents. CT shows dependent consolidation (right lower lobe, posterior segments) in acute setting.

entries.title: J69.1 - Pneumonitis Due to Inhalation of Oils and Essences
entries.content: Lipoid pneumonia. From aspiration of lipid material (mineral oil, petroleum). CT shows consolidation with fat attenuation (-30 to -150 HU). Crazy-paving pattern may be seen.

entries.title: J70.0 - Acute Pulmonary Manifestations Due to Radiation
entries.content: Radiation pneumonitis. Acute lung injury 4-12 weeks after thoracic radiation. CT shows GGO and consolidation conforming to radiation port, not anatomic boundaries.

entries.title: J70.1 - Chronic Pulmonary Manifestations Due to Radiation
entries.content: Radiation fibrosis. Late fibrotic changes from radiation therapy. CT shows fibrosis with volume loss and traction bronchiectasis conforming to radiation field.

entries.title: J70.2 - Acute Drug-Induced Interstitial Lung Disorders
entries.content: Drug-induced lung disease, acute. Pulmonary toxicity from medications (chemotherapy, amiodarone, methotrexate). CT shows diffuse or patchy GGO, consolidation.

entries.title: J70.4 - Drug-Induced Interstitial Lung Disorders, Unspecified
entries.content: Drug-induced interstitial lung disease, unspecified. Chronic lung toxicity from medications. Various CT patterns possible including NSIP, OP, and fibrosis patterns.

entries.title: J80 - Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome
entries.content: ARDS (Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome). Severe acute lung injury with diffuse alveolar damage. CT shows bilateral, diffuse, dependent GGO and consolidation.

entries.title: J81.0 - Acute Pulmonary Edema
entries.content: Acute pulmonary edema. Fluid accumulation in alveoli, usually cardiogenic. CT shows bilateral GGO, interlobular septal thickening, pleural effusions, and cardiomegaly.

entries.title: J81.1 - Chronic Pulmonary Edema
entries.content: Chronic pulmonary edema. Prolonged fluid accumulation, often from heart failure. CT shows GGO, septal thickening, pleural effusions, and signs of heart failure.

entries.title: J82.83 - Eosinophilic Asthma
entries.content: Eosinophilic asthma. Asthma with eosinophilic airway inflammation. CT may show bronchial wall thickening, mucoid impaction, and air trapping.

entries.title: J84.01 - Alveolar Proteinosis
entries.content: Pulmonary alveolar proteinosis (PAP). Accumulation of surfactant in alveoli. Classic CT finding is crazy-paving pattern (GGO with septal thickening) with geographic distribution.

entries.title: J84.02 - Pulmonary Alveolar Microlithiasis
entries.content: Pulmonary alveolar microlithiasis. Rare disease with calcium microliths in alveoli. CT shows dense, diffuse micronodules giving ground-glass appearance, subpleural linear calcifications.

entries.title: J84.03 - Idiopathic Pulmonary Hemosiderosis
entries.content: Idiopathic pulmonary hemosiderosis. Recurrent alveolar hemorrhage leading to hemosiderin deposition. CT shows GGO in acute phase, reticular opacities and fibrosis chronically.

entries.title: J84.111 - Idiopathic Interstitial Pneumonia, Not Otherwise Specified
entries.content: Idiopathic interstitial pneumonia, NOS. Use when specific IIP subtype cannot be determined. Requires multidisciplinary discussion for classification.

entries.title: J84.113 - Idiopathic Non-Specific Interstitial Pneumonitis
entries.content: Idiopathic NSIP (nonspecific interstitial pneumonia). CT shows bilateral, symmetric, basal predominant GGO and reticular opacities. Less honeycombing than UIP.

metadata.ct_pattern: Bilateral basal GGO and reticulation, subpleural sparing

entries.title: J84.114 - Acute Interstitial Pneumonitis
entries.content: Acute interstitial pneumonitis (AIP, Hamman-Rich syndrome). Rapidly progressive ILD with DAD pattern. CT shows bilateral extensive GGO and consolidation, similar to ARDS.

entries.title: J84.115 - Respiratory Bronchiolitis Interstitial Lung Disease
entries.content: RB-ILD (Respiratory bronchiolitis-ILD). Smoking-related ILD. CT shows centrilobular nodules, patchy GGO, bronchial wall thickening. Upper lobe predominant.

entries.title: J84.116 - Cryptogenic Organizing Pneumonia
entries.content: Cryptogenic organizing pneumonia (COP, formerly BOOP). CT shows patchy consolidation with peribronchovascular and subpleural distribution. Reversed halo sign may be present.

entries.title: J84.117 - Desquamative Interstitial Pneumonia
entries.content: Desquamative interstitial pneumonia (DIP). Smoking-related ILD. CT shows diffuse GGO with lower lobe predominance. Better prognosis than UIP.

entries.title: J84.170 - Interstitial Lung Disease with Progressive Fibrotic Phenotype
entries.content: Progressive pulmonary fibrosis. ILD with progressive fibrotic phenotype regardless of underlying diagnosis. CT shows worsening fibrosis over time.

entries.title: J84.2 - Lymphoid Interstitial Pneumonia
entries.content: Lymphoid interstitial pneumonia (LIP). Benign lymphoproliferative disorder. CT shows diffuse GGO, centrilobular nodules, and thin-walled cysts. Associated with Sjogren's syndrome and HIV.

entries.title: J84.81 - Lymphangioleiomyomatosis
entries.content: Lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM). Cystic lung disease in women. CT shows numerous thin-walled cysts diffusely distributed throughout both lungs.

entries.title: J84.82 - Adult Pulmonary Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis
entries.content: Pulmonary Langerhans cell histiocytosis (PLCH). Smoking-related cystic lung disease. CT shows upper and middle lobe cysts with bizarre shapes, nodules early in disease.

entries.title: J84.83 - Surfactant Mutations of the Lung
entries.content: Surfactant mutations of the lung. Genetic disorders of surfactant production causing ILD. CT shows diffuse GGO and variable fibrosis.

entries.title: J84.841 - Neuroendocrine Cell Hyperplasia of Infancy
entries.content: Neuroendocrine cell hyperplasia of infancy (NEHI). Pediatric ILD. CT shows geographic GGO with mosaic attenuation and air trapping.

entries.title: J84.848 - Other Interstitial Lung Diseases of Childhood
entries.content: Other interstitial lung diseases of childhood. Pediatric ILD not elsewhere classified.

entries.title: J85.1 - Abscess of Lung with Pneumonia
entries.content: Lung abscess with pneumonia. Necrotic lung infection with cavity formation. CT shows thick-walled cavity with air-fluid level within area of consolidation.

entries.title: J85.2 - Abscess of Lung Without Pneumonia
entries.content: Lung abscess without pneumonia. Isolated lung abscess, may be from aspiration or septic embolism. CT shows thick-walled cavity, may have surrounding consolidation.

entries.title: J86.0 - Pyothorax with Fistula
entries.content: Empyema with bronchopleural fistula. Infected pleural space with communication to bronchus. CT shows pleural collection with air and may show fistula tract.

entries.title: J86.9 - Pyothorax Without Fistula
entries.content: Empyema without fistula. Infected pleural fluid collection. CT shows pleural effusion with enhancement of parietal and visceral pleura (split pleura sign), may have loculations.

entries.title: J91.8 - Pleural Effusion in Other Conditions Classified Elsewhere
entries.content: Pleural effusion in conditions classified elsewhere. Code the underlying condition first. Includes effusion due to heart failure, cirrhosis, nephrotic syndrome.

entries.title: J92.0 - Pleural Plaque with Presence of Asbestos
entries.content: Pleural plaque due to asbestos exposure. Benign pleural thickening from asbestos. CT shows bilateral parietal pleural plaques, often calcified, along lower chest wall and diaphragm.

entries.title: J92.9 - Pleural Plaque Without Asbestos
entries.content: Pleural plaque without asbestos exposure documented. Focal pleural thickening that may be calcified. May be idiopathic or from other causes.

entries.title: J93.81 - Chronic Pneumothorax
entries.content: Chronic pneumothorax. Persistent air in pleural space. May have thickened visceral pleura. Often requires surgical intervention.

entries.title: J93.83 - Other Pneumothorax
entries.content: Other pneumothorax. Pneumothorax not fitting other specific categories. Includes catamenial pneumothorax (associated with menstruation, endometriosis).

entries.title: J94.0 - Chylous Effusion
entries.content: Chylothorax. Chyle (lymphatic fluid) in pleural space. CT shows pleural effusion; fluid density may be slightly lower than simple effusion. Often from thoracic duct injury or lymphoma.

entries.title: J94.1 - Fibrothorax
entries.content: Fibrothorax. Thick fibrous pleural peel encasing the lung. CT shows markedly thickened pleura with volume loss and trapped lung. Often sequela of empyema or hemothorax.

entries.title: J94.2 - Hemothorax
entries.content: Hemothorax. Blood in pleural space. CT shows pleural effusion with higher attenuation (35-70 HU) than simple effusion. Causes include trauma, malignancy, and pulmonary infarction.

entries.title: J94.8 - Other Specified Pleural Conditions
entries.content: Other specified pleural conditions. Includes pleural calcification and other pleural abnormalities not classified elsewhere.

entries.title: J95.1 - Acute Pulmonary Insufficiency Following Thoracic Surgery
entries.content: Acute pulmonary insufficiency following thoracic surgery. Respiratory failure after lung surgery. CT may show atelectasis, edema, pneumonia, or other postoperative complications.

entries.title: J95.3 - Chronic Pulmonary Insufficiency Following Surgery
entries.content: Chronic pulmonary insufficiency following surgery. Long-term respiratory compromise after thoracic surgery. CT shows post-surgical changes and may show fibrosis.

entries.title: J95.811 - Postprocedural Pneumothorax
entries.content: Postprocedural pneumothorax. Iatrogenic pneumothorax following procedure (biopsy, central line, thoracentesis). CT shows pneumothorax; important to document if intervention needed.

entries.title: J95.812 - Postprocedural Air Leak
entries.content: Postprocedural air leak. Persistent air leak after thoracic surgery, usually from staple line or parenchymal injury. CT shows pneumothorax or subcutaneous emphysema.

entries.title: J96.00 - Acute Respiratory Failure, Unspecified
entries.content: Acute respiratory failure, unspecified whether with hypoxia or hypercapnia. Severe respiratory compromise requiring urgent intervention. CT may show underlying cause.

entries.title: J96.01 - Acute Respiratory Failure with Hypoxia
entries.content: Acute respiratory failure with hypoxia. Type 1 respiratory failure with low oxygen. CT findings depend on underlying etiology.

entries.title: J96.02 - Acute Respiratory Failure with Hypercapnia
entries.content: Acute respiratory failure with hypercapnia. Type 2 respiratory failure with elevated CO2. Often from COPD exacerbation or neuromuscular disease.

entries.title: J98.0 - Diseases of Bronchus, Not Elsewhere Classified
entries.content: Diseases of bronchus NEC. Includes broncholithiasis (calcified material in bronchus), bronchial stenosis, and other bronchial abnormalities.

entries.title: J98.19 - Other Pulmonary Collapse
entries.content: Other pulmonary collapse. Includes rounded atelectasis (folded lung), plate-like atelectasis, and other forms of lung collapse not classified as simple atelectasis.

entries.title: J98.5 - Diseases of Mediastinum, Not Elsewhere Classified
entries.content: Diseases of mediastinum NEC. Includes mediastinal fibrosis, mediastinal cyst, and other mediastinal abnormalities. CT appearance varies by specific condition.

entries.title: J98.6 - Disorders of Diaphragm
entries.content: Disorders of diaphragm. Includes diaphragmatic paralysis, elevation, and eventration. CT shows elevated hemidiaphragm, may have paradoxical motion on dynamic imaging.

entries.title: M34.81 - Systemic Sclerosis with Lung Involvement
entries.content: Systemic sclerosis (scleroderma) with lung involvement. ILD in scleroderma. CT shows NSIP pattern (GGO, reticulation) or UIP pattern in advanced disease. Dilated esophagus may be seen.

entries.title: M35.02 - Sicca Syndrome with Lung Involvement
entries.content: Sjogren's syndrome with lung involvement. May cause LIP, NSIP, or bronchiolitis. CT shows cysts, GGO, and bronchial abnormalities.

entries.title: M31.30 - Wegener's Granulomatosis Without Renal Involvement
entries.content: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA, Wegener's) without renal involvement. Vasculitis affecting lungs and upper airways. CT shows nodules that may cavitate, ground-glass halos.

entries.title: Q33.0 - Congenital Cystic Lung
entries.content: Congenital cystic lung disease. Includes congenital pulmonary airway malformation (CPAM). CT shows cystic mass in lung, may be single large cyst or multiple small cysts.

entries.title: Q33.6 - Congenital Hypoplasia and Dysplasia of Lung
entries.content: Congenital hypoplasia of lung. Underdeveloped lung, often unilateral. CT shows small hemithorax with mediastinal shift and small lung.

entries.title: Q34.0 - Anomaly of Pleura
entries.content: Congenital anomaly of pleura. Includes accessory fissures, azygos fissure (azygos lobe), and other pleural variants.

entries.title: R04.0 - Epistaxis
entries.content: Epistaxis (nosebleed). May be associated with bleeding disorders or local pathology. If severe and recurrent, consider HHT (hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia) with pulmonary AVMs.

entries.title: R04.89 - Hemorrhage from Other Sites in Respiratory Passages
entries.content: Hemorrhage from other respiratory sites. Includes hemorrhage from throat, larynx, or other respiratory structures not classified as hemoptysis.

entries.title: R05.1 - Acute Cough
entries.content: Acute cough. Cough of less than 3 weeks duration. Usually from acute respiratory infection. CT typically not indicated unless complicated.

entries.title: R05.2 - Subacute Cough
entries.content: Subacute cough. Cough of 3-8 weeks duration. Often post-infectious. CT may be indicated if no improvement.

entries.title: R05.3 - Chronic Cough
entries.content: Chronic cough. Cough greater than 8 weeks duration. Warrants investigation with CT to evaluate for underlying pulmonary pathology.

entries.title: R06.00 - Dyspnea, Unspecified
entries.content: Dyspnea, unspecified. Shortness of breath without further specification. Common indication for chest CT to evaluate pulmonary and cardiac causes.

entries.title: R06.01 - Orthopnea
entries.content: Orthopnea. Dyspnea when lying flat, characteristic of heart failure. CT may show pulmonary edema, cardiomegaly, and pleural effusions.

entries.title: R06.03 - Acute Respiratory Distress
entries.content: Acute respiratory distress. Severe breathing difficulty requiring urgent evaluation. CT may reveal cause: PE, pneumonia, pneumothorax, or other acute process.

entries.title: R06.09 - Other Forms of Dyspnea
entries.content: Other forms of dyspnea. Includes exertional dyspnea and other specified types of breathing difficulty.

entries.title: R06.1 - Stridor
entries.content: Stridor. High-pitched breathing sound from upper airway obstruction. CT neck/chest may show cause: foreign body, tumor, or stenosis.

entries.title: R06.2 - Wheezing
entries.content: Wheezing. Musical breath sounds from lower airway narrowing. Associated with asthma, COPD, bronchitis. CT may show air trapping or bronchial abnormalities.

entries.title: R07.1 - Chest Pain on Breathing
entries.content: Pleuritic chest pain. Sharp pain worsened by breathing. May indicate pleuritis, PE, pneumonia, or pneumothorax. CT is often indicated for workup.

entries.title: R07.89 - Other Chest Pain
entries.content: Other chest pain. Non-specific chest pain not otherwise categorized. May prompt CT to evaluate for pulmonary, vascular, or musculoskeletal causes.

entries.title: R07.9 - Chest Pain, Unspecified
entries.content: Chest pain, unspecified. Uncharacterized chest pain. Workup depends on clinical context; CT may be performed to evaluate for PE, aortic pathology, or pulmonary causes.

entries.title: R09.01 - Asphyxia
entries.content: Asphyxia. Severe hypoxia from airway obstruction or respiratory failure. Emergency condition requiring immediate intervention.

entries.title: R09.02 - Hypoxemia
entries.content: Hypoxemia. Low blood oxygen level. May be acute or chronic. CT may help identify cause: parenchymal disease, vascular abnormality, or airway disease.

entries.title: R09.1 - Pleurisy
entries.content: Pleurisy. Inflammation of the pleura causing pleuritic chest pain. CT may show pleural thickening, small effusion, or underlying cause.

entries.title: R09.3 - Abnormal Sputum
entries.content: Abnormal sputum. Includes excessive, purulent, or blood-tinged sputum. May indicate infection, malignancy, or other pulmonary pathology requiring CT evaluation.

entries.title: R09.81 - Nasal Congestion
entries.content: Nasal congestion. May be associated with sinusitis visible on chest CT scout or upper cuts. Often incidental finding.

entries.title: R23.0 - Cyanosis
entries.content: Cyanosis. Blue discoloration from hypoxemia or abnormal hemoglobin. Central cyanosis suggests significant pulmonary or cardiac disease.

entries.title: R59.0 - Localized Enlarged Lymph Nodes
entries.content: Localized lymphadenopathy. Enlarged lymph nodes in a single region. On chest CT, note size (>10mm short axis is abnormal), morphology, and distribution.

entries.title: R59.1 - Generalized Enlarged Lymph Nodes
entries.content: Generalized lymphadenopathy. Enlarged lymph nodes in multiple regions. May indicate systemic disease: lymphoma, sarcoidosis, infection, or metastatic cancer.

entries.title: R59.9 - Enlarged Lymph Nodes, Unspecified
entries.content: Enlarged lymph nodes, unspecified. Lymphadenopathy without specification of location or distribution.

entries.title: S27.0XXA - Traumatic Pneumothorax, Initial Encounter
entries.content: Traumatic pneumothorax. Air in pleural space from chest trauma. CT is highly sensitive; look for associated rib fractures, pulmonary contusion.

entries.title: S27.1XXA - Traumatic Hemothorax, Initial Encounter
entries.content: Traumatic hemothorax. Blood in pleural space from chest trauma. CT shows high-attenuation pleural fluid. May require chest tube drainage.

entries.title: S27.2XXA - Traumatic Hemopneumothorax, Initial Encounter
entries.content: Traumatic hemopneumothorax. Combined blood and air in pleural space from trauma. CT shows air-fluid level in pleural space.

entries.title: S27.321A - Contusion of Lung, Unilateral, Initial Encounter
entries.content: Pulmonary contusion, unilateral. Lung parenchymal injury from blunt trauma. CT shows patchy GGO or consolidation not conforming to anatomic boundaries.

entries.title: S27.329A - Contusion of Lung, Bilateral, Initial Encounter
entries.content: Bilateral pulmonary contusion. Lung injury affecting both lungs from severe trauma. CT shows bilateral patchy opacities.

entries.title: S27.331A - Laceration of Lung, Unilateral, Initial Encounter
entries.content: Pulmonary laceration, unilateral. Tear in lung parenchyma from trauma. CT shows cavity or cyst within area of contusion, may have air-fluid level.

entries.title: T79.0XXA - Air Embolism (Traumatic), Initial Encounter
entries.content: Traumatic air embolism. Air in pulmonary vasculature or systemic circulation. CT may show air in pulmonary arteries or cardiac chambers.

entries.title: Z90.2 - Acquired Absence of Lung
entries.content: Acquired absence of lung (post-pneumonectomy). Status post lung removal. CT shows empty hemithorax with mediastinal shift and compensatory hyperinflation of remaining lung.

entries.title: Z93.0 - Tracheostomy Status
entries.content: Tracheostomy status. Patient has tracheostomy tube. May be seen on chest CT. Note position and any complications.

entries.title: Z96.1 - Presence of Intraocular Lens
entries.content: Presence of intraocular lens. Post-cataract surgery status. Occasionally noted as incidental finding when brain included on chest CT.

entries.title: Z98.0 - Intestinal Bypass and Anastomosis Status
entries.content: Post-surgical intestinal status. May be relevant if abdominal portion of chest CT shows surgical changes.

entries.title: Z98.890 - Other Specified Postprocedural States
entries.content: Other postprocedural states. Includes post-radiation therapy status, post-ablation, and other relevant surgical histories.
